page.title: 18Ewloe Interchange
page.content: The Ewloe Interchange is part of the Hawarden By-pass, work began in february 1982 and it was opened September 1984. It was built because:{ tourist traffic jams in summer months made it impossible for local people to go about their business. It is part of aroad plan which allows factories to send goods quickly and easily in lorries between {N.Wales, Liverpool , {& the rest of Britain & Europe }via the E22 Euroroute as far as {Sussnitz {on the Baltic Coast. { }Lighting at Ewloe is provided by high mast system 30m high. The interchange has an extra 3rd lane to allow traffic to enter or leave the dual carriageway.The lanes were made of concrete because it is cheaper. The 2 firms involved in the building were Sir Alfred McAlpine and Fairclough Civil Engineering.
